required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD16+ Monocytes in Coronary Heart Disease (CHD)
clinical_study.official_title: CD16+ Monocytes in Patients With Coronary Heart Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Monocytes may be separated into phenotypically and functionally distinct cell types by the presence or absence of the lipopolysaccharide receptor CD14 and the Fcγ-receptor CD16. The investigators hypothesize that the total numbers of CD16+ monocytes are significantly related to cardiovascular outcome in patients with angiographically proven coronary heart disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute numbers of CD16+ monocytes stratified by tertiles related to the incidence of the combined endpoint
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of the combined endpoint (non-fatal myocardial infarction, cardiovascular death, stroke) during a follow-up of 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute numbers of CD16+ monocytes stratified by tertiles related to the incidence of each part of the combined endpoint + total death
secondary_outcome.description: non-fatal myocardial infarction cardiovascular death stroke total death

secondary_outcome.measure: Subgroup analysis for absolute numbers of CD16+ monocytes stratified by tertiles in relation to the combined endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: Subgroups of patients: Patients with stable Angina Patients with acute coronary syndrome

study_pop.textblock: Patients with angiographically proven coronary heart disease, admitted to the Department of Medicine or Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery of the Martin Luther-University Halle-Wittenberg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- angiographically proven coronary heart disease
- Age > 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- life expectancy < 12 months
- inability to participate in the trial (to give written informed consent)

facility.name: University Clinic of the Martin Luther-University Halle-Wittenberg
